snippet: The six-count indictment accuses a Bonanno soldier and an associate of assisting in the 2010 election of another crime family associate as the president of a Teamsters union on Long Island.
abstract: Organized crime indictment accuses Bonanno crime family members and associates of running multimillion-dollar online sports betting operation in Costa Rica, with some of them recorded making plans to sell hundreds of thousands of pills to treat erectile dysfunction; indictment also accuses two defendants of helping another defendant win 2010 election to become president of Local 917 of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters.

byline.original: By RUSS BUETTNER and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM

lead_paragraph: The six-count indictment accuses a Bonanno soldier and an associate of assisting in the 2010 election of another crime family associate as the president of a Teamsters union on Long Island.

headline.main: Bonanno Family Members Are Accused of Branching Out Online and Into Pills
headline.print_headline: Bonanno Family Members Are Accused Of Branching Out Online and Into Pills
